intro: Dacryodes hopkinsii, commonly known as the African blackwood, is a tropical tree native to western and central Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and smooth, greyish bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by elliptical, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its valuable timber, it is also considered an important species for conservation efforts.
